text: Leonard gets a PAPER out of a VENDING MACHINE - He reads the headline - "HEADLESS MAN FOUND IN LUMBERYARD Leonard reads it for a beat - Walter then approaches, carrying a box -
Hello Leonard!  Beautiful morning, isn't it?
It was. Leonard lowers the paper - his face drops -

Just wait till you see this! Walter opens the box and removes the contents - It is the HEAD of the carpenter - Walter shoves the sculp Leonard's face - Leonard drops the paper and staggers back -

(Beat)

(gleefully)

I don't want you to make any more statues.  Do you understand? No more statues.
(hurt)

Well, w-what did you do?
Never mind... Leonard puts his arm around Walter -
Walter...I decided to have that show for you, right away. Walter walks with Leonard -
When Carla comes by I'll talk to her.  She'll make up some nice invitations.  We'll have them printed up.

Walter and Carla walk down the street - Walter says nothing -
Nice night out...
Hm... The two say nothing for a beat -
Well...what did you want to talk to me about?
Well...w-what kind of people do you like, Carla?
Oh, I don't know.  Smart people. Creative people I guess.
You think I'm creative?
Of course I do!
That means you like me! Carla looks at Walter -
I like you very much, Walter.
I thought you did on account of you kissed me the other night! Carla sees where this is going and doesn't like it - the walking -

Carla - Walter tries to arrange his thoughts -
I, uh, I've been alone for a long time, and I know you've been alone because you never seem to go out with anybody - Walter looks nervously at his hands -
- even though Leonard's always asking you to go out with him and I - just -
What are you trying to say? Walter gestures for Carla to sit down at a nearby bench - down - Walter swallows appearing very nervous -
Carla... (Beat)
I don't want to make statues anymore!
You don't?
No. (Beat)
I want to get married. (Beat)
To you. Carla senses trouble -
Uh... (Beat)
...how long have you been thinking about this, Walter?
Oh...f-for a long time.  Ever since you first came to the club. Carla looks down at the ground -
You were the only one who was ever nice to me! (Beat)
I didn't know you loved me until you kissed me. Carla suddenly feels very awkward - she takes a deep brea prepares for the rejection -
Walter, I really do like you. And I did kiss you.  But... that was because of your work. Walter listens intently to every word -
There's more to being in love than just that. Carla gives a sympathetic look to Walter - Walter doesn't a beat, as if putting two and two together -
You mean...you don't love me?
Carla looks down at the ground -
I'm afraid that's what I mean. Walter begins to get very upset -
But you gotta love me! (Beat)
Why do you think I made that statue of Alice?!
Walter, I'm sorry...
You just can't be sorry! I wanna - I wanna marry you! Carla looks around -
Now calm down Walter! (Beat)
Now, let's go in there, and when the show's over, maybe we can talk about it.
No! I want to talk about it now!
Walter... (Beat)
I don't want to hurt your feelings but there is no way we're ever going to get...together.  You know what I mean?
Why not?!
Because... (Beat)
We're just friends.  That's all. Just friends.
I get it.  I see the whole thing now. No one knows if Walter Paisley is born!
Jeez, what is your problem all of a sudden?
Oh sure, let's string along poor Walter, see how far it will take us! Carla gets up -
You're starting to freak me out, Walter.  I'll see you there. Carla heads off - Walter watches her leave -
You have to love me, Carla...

Carla, would you do one favor for me?
Just about anything, Walter.
Would you let me make...a statue of you?
Carla smiles -
Would you really like to?  That would make me very happy.

Well, that's Alice. Carla is speechless -

Maxwell said it's alright. Walter takes a few steps closer -
Let them become clay in his hands so that he might mold them. Carla is clearly frightened -
